result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jsonin J. Dilley

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases 21CF862, 22CF48 called at 9:48 AM-by Zoom) Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional Facility.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jsonin J. Dilley. ADA Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
9:52 AM- Off the record for Attorney Thorson to join a breakout room via Zoom with the defendant.
10:03 AM- Back on the record. District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense indicates the Defendant wants to take the offer (PSI recommended) and waive his right to a jury trial- requests plea hearing be scheduled. Defense waives right to personal appearance. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to a jury trial. Defendant waives his right to jury trial in both cases freely and voluntarily. State waives their right to jury trial in both cases. Final Status Conferences and Jury trials in both cases are removed. Defendant requests to have any future court dates by Zoom- waives right to personal appearances. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Plea Hearing: 11/08/2022 at 3:30 PM (Set for 15 minutes- Defendant to appear by Zoom)
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:40 PM cases 21CF862, 22CF48 called. Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Jsonin J. Dilley from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. There is no agreement and the State asks both files put on the trial calendar, 22CF48 to be tried first. 
A final Status Conference and a two day jury trial is to be set in 22CF48 and a 3 day trial is to be set 21CF862. 
Motions to be filed one week before the final status conference. State advises the Defense they plan to file an Other Acts motion.
Plea hearing on August 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:45 PM cases 21CF862, 22CF48 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jsonin J. Dilley. . Defendant would like to appear via Zoom for the next hearing as well. Attorney Thorson needs to complete paperwork with the defendant. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for August 19 2022 at 3:30 PM (via Zoom, 30 min).
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

(11:31 AM cases 21CF862, 22CF48 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley appeared by video, in custody in Dodge Correctional Institution. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Jsonin J. Dilley.
Attorney Thorson advises the State has made an offer which has been reviewed with the defendant.
Attorney Thorson advises there is no agreement at this time but is requesting to speak with the DA again.
Status Conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:30 am (1/2 hour) in person and the defendant may appear via Zoom.
Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 11:15 am.

3:57 PM cases 21CF862 and 22CF48 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jsonin J. Dilley. 
In 22CF48:Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 30 days for motions which can be extended for good cause. 
Defendant will be in Dodge Correctional beginning May 27th- Defendant waives their right to appear in person for the next hearing. A Status conference in both files is scheduled for June 22nd at 11:15 PM (via Zoom for defendant).
Arraignment on May 23, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Same as Complaint.

(4:05 PM cases 21CF862, 22CF48 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Jsonin J. Dilley.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF48 and Court accepts waiver.
Attorney Thorson advises did recently receive an appeal decision on the defendant's revocation case.
Status Conference in 21CF862 and Arraignment in 22CF48 scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 3:45 pm.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward
Waiver of Prelim on April 18, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:32 PM Cases called: 21CF862 & 22CF48 Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley appeared by video in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared in court for Jsonin J. Dilley, Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing needs to be addressed in 22CF48. 
21CF862 - STC: 04/18/22 at 4pm 
22CF48 - WOPH on same date
Hearing on February 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

(Cases called at 11:21 AM - 21CF862 and 22CF48) Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.   Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared in the courtroom.   Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears for the State of Wisconsin appeared in the courtroom.
Defense has recently received an offer from the State that includes all cases.  Will need to address the preliminary hearing in 22CF48 prior to any agreement being entered.
Hearing (22CF48) / Status Conference (21CF862): February 24, 2022 at 3:30 PM (by Zoom; if in-person is requested, the request by Defense needs to be made a few days in advance)

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson

(11:02 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Jsonin J. Dilley. 
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on January 26, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 11:45 am in Branch 2.

Conditions:
No contact with A.W.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

*Defendant refused to sign.*

11:48 AM case called. Reserve Judge William Gabler for Branch 3 Intake. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jsonin J. Dilley not in court and does not appear via Zoom. State requests case be scheduled for initial appearance January 31, 2022 at 11:45 AM in Branch 2.
